Student Debt Payback LagsAndrea Fuller and Douglas Belkin3/28/2022

More than half of students at 347 colleges and vocational schools defaulted on their loans or failed to pay down even a single dollar of their debt after seven years, according to a Wall Street Journal analysis of federal data released Saturday.

  (function() {

        credentials: 'include',
        headers: {
          'X-ENCRYPTED-DOCUMENT-KEY': encryptedDocumentKey,

      return fetch(endpointURL, options).then((response) => response.json());
    }

      performance.mark('ads-request-entitlements');

      };

      if(isSnippetView) {

        window.utag_data.profiles = {

        window.utag_data.user_exp = 'default';
        window.utag_data.user_ref = '';
        window.utag_data.user_tags = '';

        window.utag_data.article_template = 'preview';

      }

      const encryptedDocumentKey = '';
      window.entitlementsAsyncData = getCurrentUser(entitlementsUrl, encryptedDocumentKey);

      window.entitlementsAsyncData
        .then((retrievedUser = {}) => {

          if (retrievedUser.redirect) {
            window.location.href = retrievedUser.redirect;
            return;

          const {

    requestEntitlements();

readabilityObject.excerpt: More than half of students at 347 colleges and vocational schools defaulted on their loans or failed to pay down even a single dollar of their debt after seven years, according to a Wall Street Journal analysis of federal data released Saturday.
